newsitem.title: USA: Daniel Day-Lewis marries Rebecca Miller.
newsitem.headline: Daniel Day-Lewis marries Rebecca Miller.

text.p: Actor Daniel Day-Lewis has married actress Rebecca Miller, daughter of playwright Arthur Miller, his publicist confirmed on Monday.
The couple wed in a private ceremony last Wednesday in Vermont, publicist Cynthia Parsons said.
The wedding was first reported over the weekend by syndicated gossip columnist Liz Smith.
Day-Lewis has been making the film version of Miller's 1953 play, "The Crucible," about witch trials in Salem, Massachusetts. The movie also stars Winona Ryder.
Day-Lewis, 39, won an Oscar for his role in "My Left Foot." He also has appeared in "In the Name of the Father," "The Last of the Mohicans" and "Age of Innocence."
His father was the late British poet and writer Cecil Day-Lewis.
Miller, 32, is an actress and director.
Neither Miller nor Day-Lewis has been married previously.
Day-Lewis fathered a son by French actress Isabelle Adjani. The baby was born last spring.
